went to the tree and said, "I will break you, tree!" He started to hit the tree with his axe. But the tree was very strong. Tom hit the tree again and again, but it did not break.
A little bird saw Tom and said, "Please, do not break the tree. It is my home." Tom felt sad and stopped hitting the tree. He said, "I am sorry, little bird. I will not break your home."
Tom and the little bird became friends. They played together every day. And the big tree in the dark forest stayed strong and safe.

Sue and Bob went to a tree. Sue found a rope and tried to tie Bob to the tree. But the rope was too short. So, she looked around and found a longer rope. This time, Sue could tie Bob to the tree. They both were happy.
Then, something unexpected happened. A tiny mouse came and untied the rope. Bob was free again! The mouse wanted to be friends with Bob and Sue. They all played together and had lots of fun. From that day on, the huge horse, the girl, and the tiny mouse were the best of friends.

Kitty met a dog named Spot. Spot said, "Kitty, you must behave when you play with the animals." Kitty promised she would. But Kitty was nosy, and she couldn't help but poke her nose into everything.
One day, Kitty found a big egg. She thought it was a chicken egg, but it was not. The egg started to crack, and something unexpected happened. A baby duck came out of the egg! Kitty was surprised, but she took care of the baby duck. They became best friends, and Kitty learned to behave on her vacation.
